iqdvqZOJGec1x7sPtFzRYw.text: BEST CHICKEN OF ALL TIME!! Loved the food here enough to come back for lunch the next day.  Perfectly cooked and flavored flame fired chicken.  Sides are great also. Pita with hummus to die for.   5 Stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Nando's - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Amazing flavor!! Lemon/herb

qM6JjUxz1VcFXmV9XVUg8w.text: It's Nando's.  Good chicken and other food in a casual atmosphere.  Reasonable prices and good options.  It's better than most fast food restaurants.

S9r57L1dcN0WqTuDgQLjxA.text: If you are eating here, they offer 20% off parking at the Omni Centre Q-Park. But be warned, parking at Omni is expensive.

tdwUOSxebqSEOjrJ_Ux9LQ.text: What can I say? It's a modern, spacious Nando's. It was a bit noisy yesterday but that is to be expected as it is in the Omni which seems to be the top hangout spot for Edinburgh teens.  It was really busy when we arrived but we managed to get a table and it quietened down once our food arrived.  I had the butterfly chicken with chips and corn on the cob. I decided to go for medium spice instead of plain - good decision! Much more flavourful than when I used it order it plain.  I suppose I seem a bit brutal giving it a 3 stars for an enjoyable experience but it's a Nando's for Christ's sake!  One issue I have with Nando's is that they do not offer free wifi which in this day and age is very annoying.

aYZQuQIxXMZUYJgs7O0ngw.text: What can I say, it's a nicely decorated nando's situated in the omni centre. But it is just your bog standard nando's. I'm not a huge fan of nando's and have never got what the fuss is about. I got the butterfly chicken, chips and coleslaw. The chicken was really dry and I always find the fid lukewarm.

photos.caption: Photo of Nando's - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

B7rMMkPNVbVdjhoZxLSZqQ.text: I really don't get what the big deal is about. I guess the price is okay, but nothing to write home about.
